cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the southeastern Gulf, forecast to turn northwest on Wednesday and head toward the upper Texas–Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border (roughly between Port Bolivar TX and Lake Charles LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Bolivar TX to west of Morgan City LA (hurricane watch); south of Port Bolivar to San Luis Pass TX (tropical storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along Texas coast at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: High Island TX to Morgan City LA (7‒11 ft possible) with 2‒4 ft in Galveston Bay and San Luis Pass to Port Bolivar
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with a 57 % chance of occurrence; hurricane-force winds possible if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible in Galveston Bay and the Texas City area, higher if landfall drifts west.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts possible, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and dangerous rip currents/swells.
